heading: Program Outcomes, Program Educational Objectives & Program Specific Outcomes
description: Comprehensive framework defining the educational goals, expected competencies, and specialized outcomes for B.Pharma graduates.

sections.title: Program Outcomes (POs)
sections.description: Program Outcomes define what students are expected to know and be able to do by the time of graduation.

items.title: Pharmacy Knowledge
items.description: Possess knowledge and comprehension of the core and basic knowledge associated with the profession of pharmacy, including biomedical sciences, pharmaceutical sciences, behavioral, social, and administrative pharmacy sciences, and manufacturing practices.

items.title: Planning Abilities
items.description: Demonstrate effective planning abilities including time management, resource management, delegation skills, and organizational skills. Develop and implement plans and organize work to meet deadlines.

items.title: Problem Analysis
items.description: Utilize the principles of scientific inquiry, thinking analytically, clearly, and critically, while solving problems and making decisions during daily practice. Find, analyze, evaluate, and apply information systematically and shall make defensible decisions.

items.title: Modern Tool Usage
items.description: Learn, select, and apply appropriate methods and procedures, resources, and modern pharmacy-related computing tools with an understanding of the limitations.

items.title: Leadership Skills
items.description: Understand and consider the human reaction to change, motivation issues, leadership, and team-building when planning changes required for fulfillment of practice, professional, and societal responsibilities.

items.title: Professional Identity
items.description: Understand, analyze, and communicate the value of their professional roles in society (e.g. health care professionals, promoters of health, educators, managers, employers, employees).

items.title: Pharmaceutical Ethics
items.description: Honor personal values and apply ethical principles in professional and social contexts. Demonstrate behavior that recognizes cultural and personal variability in values, communication, and lifestyles. Use ethical frameworks; apply ethical principles while making decisions and take responsibility for the outcomes associated with the decisions.

items.title: Communication
items.description: Communicate effectively with the pharmacy community and with society at large, such as being able to comprehend and write effective reports, make effective presentations, and documentation, and give and receive clear instructions.

items.title: The Pharmacist and Society
items.description: Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, and legal issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional pharmacy practice.

items.title: Environment and Sustainability
items.description: Understand the impact of the professional pharmacy solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.

items.title: Life-long Learning
items.description: Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change. Self-assess and use feedback effectively from others to identify learning needs and to satisfy these needs on an ongoing basis.

sections.title: Program Specific Outcomes (PSOs)
sections.description: Program Specific Outcomes articulate what students should be able to do specifically in Pharmacy practice.

items.title: Pharmaceutical Care
items.description: Provide patient-centered care by identifying, resolving, and preventing drug-related problems in coordination with healthcare team.

items.title: Drug Development and Quality
items.description: Understand and apply the principles of drug design, development, formulation, analysis, and quality assurance in pharmaceutical manufacturing.

items.title: Community Pharmacy Practice
items.description: Demonstrate competency in community pharmacy settings including dispensing, patient counseling, health promotion, and pharmaceutical care services.

sections.title: Program Educational Objectives (PEOs)
sections.description: Program Educational Objectives define the expected accomplishments of graduates during the first few years after graduation.

items.title: Professional Practice
items.description: Graduates will be employed as pharmacists in community pharmacies, hospitals, pharmaceutical industry, regulatory agencies, or pursue entrepreneurship in pharmacy sector.

items.title: Advanced Learning and Research
items.description: Graduates will pursue higher education (M.Pharma, MBA, Ph.D.) or engage in research activities in pharmaceutical sciences and contribute to the advancement of pharmaceutical knowledge.

items.title: Professional Development
items.description: Graduates will demonstrate professional growth through continuous learning, ethical practice, and contribution to the pharmacy profession and society.

items.title: Societal Impact
items.description: Graduates will contribute to public health through pharmaceutical care services, health education, and participation in healthcare programs addressing societal needs.
